subject: Re: Follow-up on Our Discussion Regarding My Employment
bodySnippet:
--0000000000001ffc5e064022fc53
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi Brenda,


Thank you for your email. To be very clear, I am not resigning from my
position. If PFN feels the need to terminate my employment, then you have
the right to do so. However, I would like to proceed amicably and would
appreciate it if you could first provide the full accounting of the amounts
owed to me so that we can discuss this in a fair and transparent manner.


I also want to note that my NMLS license remains active with PFN, and I
currently have loans in the pipeline that need to be managed appropriately.
While I understand the reference to a compliance issue, PFN has been aware
of my involvement with Lendwise for several months and did not raise any
objections until now.


For nearly two years, I have been handling recruitment and have provided
all necessary information regarding overrides and compensation to Marc,
yourself, and previously to Anthony when he was president. Despite numerous
attempts to resolve this matter constructively, it has remained
outstanding. I hope we can address this properly now.


I look forward to resolving this cooperatively.


[image: NMLS 103098] <http://pfnloans.com/>

*David Young*

*VP of Business Development*

subject: Adjusted bonus comp for Aaron Jensen
bodySnippet:
--0000000000004bf54d060b673d34
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi Brenda,



As discussed, remove the .3 BPS override on any new LO=E2=80=99s that Aaron=
 helps
recruit and adjust it to the bonus structure below. Thank you!



   1. Bonus Terms:

                                     I.*$15.00 (Fifteen Dollars)* for every
appointment scheduled with a Loan Officer that is successfully connected
with a Priority Financial Network Manager.

                                   II.*$25.00 (Twenty-Five Dollars)* for
every appointment scheduled with a recruited Loan Officer at the Corporate
office.

                                 III.*$200.00 (Two-Hundred Dollars)* for
every hired Loan Officer recruited.

   1. Bonuses are paid on a retroactive basis (the 15th of each month).
